metadata.title: CVE-2023-3776 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's net/sched: cls_fwcomponent can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Iftcf_change_indev() fails, fw_set_parms() will immediately return an errorafter incrementing or decrementing the reference counter intcf_bind_filter(). If an attacker can control the reference counter and setit to zero, they can cause the reference to be freed, leading to ause-after-free vulnerability. We recommend upgrading past commit0323bce598eea038714f941ce2b22541c46d488f.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3776` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-244-generic - 4.4.0-244.278
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-244-generic - 4.4.0-244.278
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-244-lowlatency - 4.4.0-244.278
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-216-generic - 4.15.0-216.227~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-216-generic - 4.15.0-216.227~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-216-lowlatency - 4.15.0-216.227~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1123-kvm - 4.4.0-1123.133
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1160-aws - 4.4.0-1160.175
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1160-aws - 4.15.0-1160.173~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1169-azure - 4.15.0-1169.184~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1154-gcp - 4.15.0-1154.171~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-oracle - 4.15.0-1123.134~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-244.278').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-216.227~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.133').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1160.175').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1160.173~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1169.184~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1092.99').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1154.171~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.134~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
